history.proof: intros. unfold fun_leq in *. intros. shelve.

exceptions.exn: In environment A : Type B : poset x, y, z : A -> B H : forall x0 : A, x x0 <== y x0 H0 : forall x : A, y x <== z x x0 : A The term "x" has type "A -> B" while it is expected to have type "A".

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof, without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Sovle This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
A: Type
B: poset
z: A -> B
y: A -> B
x: A -> B

Goal:
fun_leq x y -> fun_leq y z -> fun_leq x z

Premises:
fun_leq = fun p1 p2 : A -> B => forall x : A, p1 x <== p2 x : (A -> B) -> (A -> B) -> Prop Arguments fun_leq (_ _)%function_scope
Notation poset := Poset.type
fun_asym : forall x y : A -> B, fun_leq x y -> fun_leq y x -> x = y
fun_refl : forall x : A -> B, fun_leq x x
Relation_Operators.clos_trans_ind : forall (A : Type) (R : Relation_Definitions.relation A) (P : A -> A -> Prop), (forall x y : A, R x y -> P x y) -> (forall x y z : A, Relation_Operators.clos_trans A R x y -> P x y -> Relation_Operators.clos_trans A R y z -> P y z -> P x z) -> forall x a : A, Relation_Operators.clos_trans A R x a -> P x a
pair_trans : forall (A B : poset) (x y z : A * B), pair_leq x y -> pair_leq y z -> pair_leq x z
Setoid.Seq_trans : forall (A : Type) (Aeq : Relation_Definitions.relation A), Setoid.Setoid_Theory A Aeq -> forall x y z : A, Aeq x y -> Aeq y z -> Aeq x z
Inductive clos_trans (A : Type) (R : Relation_Definitions.relation A) (x : A) : A -> Prop := t_step : forall y : A, R x y -> Relation_Operators.clos_trans A R x y | t_trans : forall y z : A, Relation_Operators.clos_trans A R x y -> Relation_Operators.clos_trans A R y z -> Relation_Operators.clos_trans A R x z Arguments Relation_Operators.clos_trans _%type_scope Arguments Relation_Operators.t_step _%type_scope Arguments Relation_Operators.t_trans _%type_scope
poset_trans : forall (T : poset) (y x z : T), x <== y -> y <== z -> x <== z
PosetMixin : forall (T : Type) (mx_leq : T -> T -> Prop), (forall x : T, mx_leq x x) -> (forall x y : T, mx_leq x y -> mx_leq y x -> x = y) -> (forall x y z : T, mx_leq x y -> mx_leq y z -> mx_leq x z) -> Poset.mixin_of T
Record mixin_of (T : Type) : Type := Mixin { mx_leq : T -> T -> Prop; _ : forall x : T, mx_leq x x; _ : forall x y : T, mx_leq x y -> mx_leq y x -> x = y; _ : forall x y z : T, mx_leq x y -> mx_leq y z -> mx_leq x z } Arguments Poset.mixin_of _%type_scope Arguments Poset.Mixin [T]%type_scope [mx_leq]%function_scope (_ _ _)%function_scope
BinInt.Z.divide = fun x y : BinNums.Z => exists z : BinNums.Z, y = BinInt.Z.mul z x : BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z -> Prop Arguments BinInt.Z.divide (_ _)%Z_scope
sub_trans : forall (T : poset) (s : Pred T) (x : {x : T | x \In s}) (y z : {x0 : T | x0 \In s}), sub_leq x y -> sub_leq y z -> sub_leq x z
pair_asym : forall (A B : poset) (x y : A * B), pair_leq x y -> pair_leq y x -> x = y
Setoid.Seq_sym : forall (A : Type) (Aeq : Relation_Definitions.relation A), Setoid.Setoid_Theory A Aeq -> forall x y : A, Aeq x y -> Aeq y x
ARmul_assoc : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), almost_ring_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req -> forall x y z : R, req (rmul x (rmul y z)) (rmul (rmul x y) z)
poset_asym : forall (T : poset) (x y : T), x <== y -> y <== x -> x = y
Record almost_ring_theory (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop) : Prop := mk_art { ARadd_0_l : forall x : R, req (radd rO x) x; ARadd_comm : forall x y : R, req (radd x y) (radd y x); ARadd_assoc : forall x y z : R, req (radd x (radd y z)) (radd (radd x y) z); ARmul_1_l : forall x : R, req (rmul rI x) x; ARmul_0_l : forall x : R, req (rmul rO x) rO; ARmul_comm : forall x y : R, req (rmul x y) (rmul y x); ARmul_assoc : forall x y z : R, req (rmul x (rmul y z)) (rmul (rmul x y) z); ARdistr_l : forall x y z : R, req (rm...
BinInt.Z.le = fun x y : BinNums.Z => BinInt.Z.compare x y <> Gt : BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z -> Prop Arguments BinInt.Z.le (_ _)%Z_scope
BinPos.Pos.lt = fun x y : BinNums.positive => BinPos.Pos.compare x y = Lt : BinNums.positive -> BinNums.positive -> Prop Arguments BinPos.Pos.lt (_ _)%positive_scope
BinInt.Z.lt = fun x y : BinNums.Z => BinInt.Z.compare x y = Lt : BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z -> Prop Arguments BinInt.Z.lt (_ _)%Z_scope
BinPos.Pos.le = fun x y : BinNums.positive => BinPos.Pos.compare x y <> Gt : BinNums.positive -> BinNums.positive -> Prop Arguments BinPos.Pos.le (_ _)%positive_scope
sub_asym : forall (T : poset) (s : Pred T) (x : {x : T | x \In s}) (y : {x0 : T | x0 \In s}), sub_leq x y -> sub_leq y x -> x = y
BinPosDef.Pos.leb = fun x y : BinNums.positive => match BinPosDef.Pos.compare x y with | Gt => false | _ => true end : BinNums.positive -> BinNums.positive -> bool Arguments BinPosDef.Pos.leb (_ _)%positive_scope
Zbool.Zeq_bool = fun x y : BinNums.Z => match BinInt.Z.compare x y with | Eq => true | _ => false end : BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z -> bool Arguments Zbool.Zeq_bool (_ _)%Z_scope
BinIntDef.Z.leb = fun x y : BinNums.Z => match BinIntDef.Z.compare x y with | Gt => false | _ => true end : BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z -> bool Arguments BinIntDef.Z.leb (_ _)%Z_scope
BinIntDef.Z.pow = fun x y : BinNums.Z => match y with | BinNums.Z0 => BinNums.Zpos BinNums.xH | BinNums.Zpos p => BinIntDef.Z.pow_pos x p | BinNums.Zneg _ => BinNums.Z0 end : BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z Arguments BinIntDef.Z.pow (_ _)%Z_scope
Record ring_morph (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop) (C : Type) (cO cI : C) (cadd cmul csub : C -> C -> C) (copp : C -> C) (ceqb : C -> C -> bool) (phi : C -> R) : Prop := mkmorph { morph0 : req (phi cO) rO; morph1 : req (phi cI) rI; morph_add : forall x y : C, req (phi (cadd x y)) (radd (phi x) (phi y)); morph_sub : forall x y : C, req (phi (csub x y)) (rsub (phi x) (phi y)); morph_mul : forall x y : C, req (phi (cmul x y)) (rmul (phi x) (phi y)); morph_opp : forall x : C, req (phi (copp x)) (ropp (phi x)); morph_eq : forall...
BinIntDef.Z.add = fun x y : BinNums.Z => match x with | BinNums.Z0 => y | BinNums.Zpos x' => match y with | BinNums.Z0 => x | BinNums.Zpos y' => BinNums.Zpos (BinPos.Pos.add x' y') | BinNums.Zneg y' => BinIntDef.Z.pos_sub x' y' end | BinNums.Zneg x' => match y with | BinNums.Z0 => x | BinNums.Zpos y' => BinIntDef.Z.pos_sub y' x' | BinNums.Zneg y' => BinNums.Zneg (BinPos.Pos.add x' y') end end : BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z Arguments BinIntDef.Z.add (_ _)%Z_scope
Setoid.Seq_refl : forall (A : Type) (Aeq : Relation_Definitions.relation A), Setoid.Setoid_Theory A Aeq -> forall x : A, Aeq x x
fext : forall (A : Type) (B : A -> Type) (f1 f2 : forall x : A, B x), (forall x : A, f1 x = f2 x) -> f1 = f2
nary_congruence : forall n : nat, let k := fun (B : Type) (e : B -> B -> Prop) => forall y : B, e y y in nary_congruence_statement n k
BinIntDef.Z.to_N = fun z : BinNums.Z => match z with | BinNums.Zpos p => BinNums.Npos p | _ => BinNums.N0 end : BinNums.Z -> BinNums.N Arguments BinIntDef.Z.to_N _%Z_scope
Znumtheory.Zis_gcd_intro : forall a b g : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.divide g a -> BinInt.Z.divide g b -> (forall x : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.divide x a -> BinInt.Z.divide x b -> BinInt.Z.divide x g) -> Znumtheory.Zis_gcd a b g
Relation_Definitions.relation = fun A : Type => A -> A -> Prop : Type -> Type Arguments Relation_Definitions.relation _%type_scope
get_signZ = fun z : BinNums.Z => match z with | BinNums.Zneg p => Some (BinNums.Zpos p) | _ => None end : BinNums.Z -> option BinNums.Z Arguments get_signZ _%Z_scope
BinIntDef.Z.mul = fun x y : BinNums.Z => match x with | BinNums.Z0 => BinNums.Z0 | BinNums.Zpos x' => match y with | BinNums.Z0 => BinNums.Z0 | BinNums.Zpos y' => BinNums.Zpos (BinPos.Pos.mul x' y') | BinNums.Zneg y' => BinNums.Zneg (BinPos.Pos.mul x' y') end | BinNums.Zneg x' => match y with | BinNums.Z0 => BinNums.Z0 | BinNums.Zpos y' => BinNums.Zneg (BinPos.Pos.mul x' y') | BinNums.Zneg y' => BinNums.Zpos (BinPos.Pos.mul x' y') end end : BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z Arguments BinIntDef.Z.mul (_ _)%Z_scope
BinIntDef.Z.abs_N = fun z : BinNums.Z => match z with | BinNums.Z0 => BinNums.N0 | BinNums.Zpos p | BinNums.Zneg p => BinNums.Npos p end : BinNums.Z -> BinNums.N Arguments BinIntDef.Z.abs_N _%Z_scope
BinIntDef.Z.abs = fun z : BinNums.Z => match z with | BinNums.Z0 => BinNums.Z0 | BinNums.Zpos p | BinNums.Zneg p => BinNums.Zpos p end : BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z Arguments BinIntDef.Z.abs _%Z_scope
pair_leq : forall A B : poset, A * B -> A * B -> Prop
BinIntDef.Z.odd = fun z : BinNums.Z => match z with | BinNums.Z0 | BinNums.Zpos (BinNums.xO _) | BinNums.Zneg (BinNums.xO _) => false | _ => true end : BinNums.Z -> bool Arguments BinIntDef.Z.odd _%Z_scope
BinIntDef.Z.even = fun z : BinNums.Z => match z with | BinNums.Z0 | BinNums.Zpos (BinNums.xO _) | BinNums.Zneg (BinNums.xO _) => true | _ => false end : BinNums.Z -> bool Arguments BinIntDef.Z.even _%Z_scope

```intros.
intros H1 H2. 
unfold fun_leq in *.
intros.
apply poset_trans with (y := y x).
- apply H1.
- apply H2.```

original: intros. intros H1 H2. unfold fun_leq in *. intros. apply poset_trans with (y := y x). - apply H1. - apply H2.
